column4: hi.  how do i disable escape sequences on the console?  that is, i just want a regular escape key
umm, I don't think you can
What exactly is? The keycode the escape key produces is the only thing it can do, anyway
sure, but it's the terminal that's choosing what to do with it right?
It's the app running in it.
Say, less would interpret that keycode as "exit"
nah the app wants a basic escape
What is a basic escape, anyway, in your opinion?
i only just found out about escape sequences, so i want an escape key where they don't exist ;)
so that i can use an app that binds something to the escape key, something used a lot
You can try killing the escape key whatsoever and then binding...
sounds good, any idea where i can start?
Well, I think the idea is something like: xmodmap -e 'keysym esc=', not sure what's the proper name for the escape key though
